posts.title: The Great Flamarion
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:Erich von Stroheim is The Great Flamarion, a marksman who employs Mary Beth Hughes and Dan Duryea, a married couple, for his vaudeville act. Having decided to rid herself of her husband, Mary Beth plots to trick von Stroheim into doing the dirty work for her.

posts.title: Romantic
posts.excerpt: Two sweethearts take a walk into the woods. This is one of Lasse Braun’s better films.

posts.title: The Adventures of Tom Sawyer
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:In the 1850s, Tom Sawyer (Tommy Kelly), a troublemaking orphan, lives with his controlling Aunt Polly (May Robson) in the small town of St. Petersburg. posts.title: Scorpio
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:Cross is an old hand at the CIA, in charge of assassinating high-ranking foreign personalities who are an obstacle to the policies of the USA. posts._title: Stephen Quay & Timothy Quay – Institute Benjamente (1995)
posts.title: Institute Benjamente
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:Jakob arrives at the Institute Benjamenta (run by brother and sister Johannes and Lisa Benjamenta) to learn to become a servant. With seven other men, he studies under Lisa: absurd lessons of movement, drawing circles, and servility. He asks for a better room. No other students arrive and none leave for employment. posts._title: Manfred Kirchheimer – Stations of the Elevated (1981) (HD)
posts.title: Stations of the Elevated (1981)
posts.excerpt: Quote:Stations of the Elevated (1981) is a 45-minute city symphony directed, produced and edited by Manfred Kirchheimer. posts.title: Love Thy Neighbour
